revision.text:
{{pp-pc1}} {{Use mdy dates|date=May 2018}} {{Infobox YouTube personality | name = Jenna Marbles | image = Jenna Marbles by Gage Skidmore 2.jpg | caption = Marbles at the 2014 [[VidCon]] | birth_name = Jenna Nicole Mourey | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|9|15}} | birth_place = [[Rochester, New York]], U.S. | height = {{convert|1.65|m|ftin|abbr=on|order=flip}} | nationality = [[United States|American]] | residence = [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S. | partner = Julien Solomita {{Infobox person|child=yes| alma_mater = [[Suffolk University]] ([[Bachelor of Science|BS]])
[[Boston University]] ([[Master of Education|MEd]])}} | occupation = {{flatlist| * [[YouTuber]] * [[vlogger]] * [[comedian]] * [[actress]] }} | website = {{URL|jennamarblesblog.com}} | pseudonym = Jenna Marbles | years_active = 2006–present | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Comedy]] * [[vlog]] }} | subscribers = 18+ million | views = 2.6+ billion | associated_acts = {{flatlist| * [[Smosh]] * [[Ryan Higa]] * Julien Solomita * [[Simply Nailogical]] * Christine Sydelko }} | silver_button = yes | silver_year = 2012 | gold_button = yes | gold_year = 2012 | diamond_button = yes | diamond_year = 2013 }} '''Jenna Nicole Mourey''' (born September 15, 1986{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/Jenna_Marbles/status/643859770882002945 |title=Jenna Mourey/Marbles on Twitter |work=Twitter}}{{cite av media |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nIsgoafssIo |title=Things I Get Excited About As An Adult |date=August 27, 2015 |publisher= |via=YouTube}}), better known by her [[pseudonym]] '''Jenna Marbles''', is an American [[YouTube personality|YouTuber]], [[vlogger]], [[comedian]], and [[actress]]. As of March 2018, her channel has over 2.6 billion video views and 18 million subscribers,{{cite av media |url=https://www.youtube.com/user/JennaMarbles |title=JennaMarbles |work=YouTube}} making it the [[List of most-subscribed YouTube channels|45th most subscribed channel on YouTube]] and the eighth most popular channel operated by a woman.{{Cite web |title=PewDiePie, Jenna Marbles, CaptainSparklez: The Web's Biggest Stars |work=[[Reason (magazine)|Reason]] |date=October 1, 2014 |accessdate=October 10, 2014 |url=http://reason.com/archives/2014/10/01/pewdiepie-captainsparklez-skydoesminecra}} Marbles is the first social media star to have a wax figure displayed in [[Madame Tussauds]] Museum, located in New York City.{{Cite news|url=http://mashable.com/2015/07/26/jenna-marbles-madame-tussauds/#pkWR4It0kZq1|title=Jenna Marbles, Smosh are first YouTube stars with their own wax figures|last=Stark|first=Chelsea|work=Mashable|access-date=October 26, 2017|language=en}} ==Early life== Marbles was born and raised in [[Rochester, New York]], where she graduated from [[Brighton High School (Rochester, New York)|Brighton High School]] in 2004. Her father is a [[chemist]] who holds several [[patents]] and she has one older brother.{{cite news |first=|last=|title=Draw My Life- Jenna Marbles |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sCxzaHC30Ec |work=[[JennaMarbles]] |publisher= |date=March 28, 2013 |accessdate=March 28, 2013}} She then moved to [[Boston]], where she attended [[Suffolk University]]. At Suffolk she obtained a [[Bachelor of Science]] in [[Psychology]], and later attended [[Boston University]] for a [[Master of Education]] in Sport Psychology and Counseling.{{Cite web |title=YouTube Star Jenna Marbles: 5 Facts About Her Rise to Internet Fame |first=Todd |last=Spangler |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=July 18, 2013 |accessdate=January 16, 2015 |url=https://variety.com/2013/digital/news/youtube-star-jenna-marbles-5-facts-about-her-rise-to-internet-fame-1200564607/}} ==Career== Marbles initially started her career with [[Barstool Sports]], where she wrote for their female counterpart site StoolLaLa.{{cite web |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/id/53821689/ns/business-small_business/t/man-behind-bible-bro-culture/#.U5DQ8fldWBI |title=The Man Behind the 'Bible of Bro Culture' |publisher=NBC News |date=December 13, 2013}} In the summer of 2010, Marbles was sharing a three-bedroom apartment in Cambridge, Massachusetts. She paid $800 rent by working various jobs, like bartending, working at a tanning salon, blogging, and [[go-go dancing]] at nightclubs.{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/04/14/fashion/jenna-marbles.html |title=The Woman With 1 Billion Clicks: Jenna Marbles |date=April 14, 2013 |work=The New York Times}} ===YouTube=== [[File:Jenna Marbles Vlogbrothers 2016.jpg|200x200px|thumb|Marbles appearing in a [[Vlogbrothers]] video, 2016.]] Marbles released a video in 2010 entitled "How To Trick People Into Thinking You're Good Looking" which was viewed over 5.3 million times in its first week.{{Cite web |title=The Woman With 1 Billion Clicks: Jenna Marbles |last=O’Leary |first=Amy |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=April 12, 2013 |accessdate=October 10, 2014 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/04/14/fashion/jenna-marbles.html?pagewanted=all}}{{cite web |title=Jenna Marbles on 1 Billion Views, Set to Overtake Ray William Johnson? |first=Jeff |last=Klima |work=[[New Media Rockstars]] |date=April 22, 2013 |accessdate=October 10, 2014 |url=http://newmediarockstars.com/2013/04/jenna-marbles-on-1-billion-views-set-to-overtake-ray-william-johnson-video/}} Her video "How To Avoid Talking To People You Don't Want To Talk To" was featured in articles by ''[[The New York Times]]'' and ''[[ABC News]]'' in August 2011. In the video, she stated, "I'm sick and tired of guys thinking that just because I showed up at a club or a dance or a bar, that I want to have their genitalia touching my backside."{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/08/14/fashion/with-grinding-an-unwanted-advance-at-the-dance.html |title=Rendering Grinders Toothless |newspaper=''The New York Times'' |date=August 12, 2011 |accessdate=October 4, 2011}}{{cite web |url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/jenna-marbles-anti-dirty-dance-teens-grinding/story?id=14314828 |title="Jenna Marbles'" Anti-Dirty Dance: Teens Say No to Grinding – ABC News |publisher=''ABC News'' |date=August 16, 2011 |accessdate=October 4, 2011}} The video had approximately 36.2 million views as of March 2018{{Cite web|url=https://socialblade.com/youtube/user/jennamarbles/videos/mostviewed|title=jennamarbles Most Viewed YouTube Videos - Socialblade.com|website=socialblade.com|access-date=March 5, 2018}}. She uploads a new video to her YouTube channel every Wednesday or Thursday. Her pseudonym "Jenna Marbles" comes from her mother's complaint that "Mourey," their legal surname, pulled up only Jenna's videos on Google. Jenna's mother was unemployed at the time that Jenna's first video went viral, and was concerned that their content might put off potential employers. The name "Marbles" comes from her dog "Mr. Marbles". {{As of|2018|05}}, Marbles' YouTube channel had about 18.1 million subscribers and 2.6 billion video views.{{Cite web |title=JennaMarbles YouTube Channel Stats, Subscriber Statistics, Ranking |work=vidstatsx.com |accessdate=April 5, 2017 |url=http://vidstatsx.com/JennaMarbles/youtube-channel}}{{Cite web|url=https://socialblade.com/youtube/user/jennamarbles|title=jennamarbles YouTube Stats, Channel Statistics - Socialblade.com|website=socialblade.com|access-date=March 12, 2018}} Marbles appeared as [[Eve]] in season 2 of ''[[Epic Rap Battles of History]]'', episode 13, "Adam vs. Eve".{{cite web |author=Sam Gutelle |url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2013/02/11/epic-rap-battles-of-history-jenna-marbles/ |title=Epic Rap Battles of History Pits Man Against Woman With Jenna Marbles |publisher=''Tubefilter'' |date=February 11, 2013 |accessdate=February 25, 2013}} She played a [[banana]] in ''[[The Annoying Orange]]'' episode "Fake n' Bacon." She played [[Miley Cyrus]] in a "[[Wrecking Ball (Miley Cyrus song)|Wrecking Ball]]"–inspired segment of YouTube Rewind 2013. On January 30, she appeared in [[Ridiculousness (TV series)#Season 4 (2014)|season four]] of ''[[Ridiculousness (TV series)|Ridiculousness]]''. Marbles appeared as herself in ''[[Smosh: The Movie]]''.{{cite web |url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4615307/?ref_=tt_cl_t15 |title=Jenna Marbles |work=IMDb}} Marbles has also professionalized her business affairs by expanding her business and bringing in people to help, including, a personal assistant, a business manager, and her mother (the chief executive officer). ===Other ventures=== Marbles released a brand of dog toys called Kermie Worm & Mr. Marbles. The toys' appearances are based upon her real dogs. She has also created items with some of her most memorable quotes printed on them (e.g. "what are this"). Marbles also hosts a weekly pop countdown on [[SiriusXM Hits 1]] called "YouTube 15".[[SiriusXM Hits 1]]{{cite web |url=http://blog.siriusxm.com/tag/jenna-marbles/ |title=jenna marbles – SiriusXM Blog |work=siriusxm.com}} In 2016, Marbles became an executive producer for ''[[Maximum Ride (2016 film)|Maximum Ride]]'', a film based on the series of novels of the same name by [[James Patterson]].{{cite web |url=https://m.imdb.com/title/tt0825283/ |title=Maximum Ride (2016) |publisher= |accessdate=October 25, 2016}} Marbles does a weekly podcast with her boyfriend [[Julien Solomita]] called "The Jenna Julien Podcast" (formerly called "The Jenna and Julien Podcast"). Topics focus on things such as stories of growing up, conspiracy theories, YouTubers and other general topics. They sometimes feature other YouTubers as guests on their podcast including [[Shane Dawson]] among others{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/user/JennaJulienPodcast|title=Jenna Julien|website=YouTube|accessdate=May 13, 2017}}. In 2017 Marbles, spoke at [[Web Summit]] in [[Lisbon]], Portugal.{{cite web|url=https://websummit.com/content-makers |title=Meet our past speakers|website=websummit.com|accessdate=August 2, 2018}} In 2018, she spoke at a web conference related to Web Summit called Rise in [[Hong Kong]].{{cite web|url=https://riseconf.com|title=Meet our 2018 speakers|website=riseconf.com|accessdate=August 2, 2018}} ==Awards and nominations== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! Year !! Award !! Category !! Result !! class="unsortable" | {{Abbr|Ref.|Reference}} |- |2014 |[[Young Hollywood Award]] |Viral Superstar |{{won}} | rowspan="4" style="text-align:center;" | {{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4615307/awards?ref_=nm_awd|title=Jenna Marbles - Awards - IMDb|last=|first=|publisher=IMDb|accessdate=December 5, 2017}} |- |2015 |rowspan="3"|[[Streamy Award]] |Best Comedy Series |{{nom}} |- |rowspan="2"|2017 |Best First-Person Series |{{nom}} |- |Audience Choice Creator of the Year |{{nom}} |} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{commons category}} * {{Official website|http://jennamarblesblog.com}} * {{YouTube|u=JennaMarbles|{{PAGENAMEBASE}}}} * {{IMDb name|4615307}} {{Streamy Awards Winners CSS}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Marbles, Jenna}} [[Category:1986 births]] [[Category:American podcasters]] [[Category:American women comedians]] [[Category:American YouTubers]] [[Category:Boston University alumni]] [[Category:Comedians from New York (state)]] [[Category:Comedy YouTubers]] [[Category:LGBT rights activists from the United States]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Actresses from Rochester, New York]] [[Category:Streamy Award winners]] [[Category:Suffolk University alumni]] [[Category:Video bloggers]] [[Category:Women video bloggers]] [[Category:YouTube Diamond Play Button recipients]] [[Category:Female YouTubers]]
